content:
As the three friends sat on the grass by the lake, the sun shone down on them, casting a warm glow over their skin. C and Elena lay back, basking in the sun's rays, while Alex remained sitting, lost in thought.

After a few minutes of silence, C turned to Alex and asked, "How are you doing today? Are you feeling any better?"

Alex sighed and shook their head. "I don't know if I'll ever feel better, C. It's just so hard to imagine a future without Anna in it."

C nodded sympathetically, understanding the pain that Alex was going through. "I know it's hard, but you have to remember that Anna would want you to be happy and to keep living your life. You can't let her death consume you."

Alex looked at C with a pained expression. "I know that, but it's easier said than done. Every day I wake up, I half-expect to see her next to me. It's like a part of me is missing, and I don't know how to fill that void."

Elena, who had been listening quietly, spoke up. "I know it's hard, but you have to find ways to cope with your grief. Maybe it could be helpful to talk to someone, or to find activities that bring you joy."

Alex nodded, considering Elena's words. "I'll try to do that. I just wish there was some way to bring her back, to have one more chance to tell her how much she meant to me."

C reached out and squeezed Alex's hand in a show of support. "I know it won't bring her back, but I promise to be here for you as much as I can. We'll get through this together, okay?"

Alex smiled weakly, grateful for C's support. "Thanks, C. I appreciate it. I just wish things could go back to the way they were before."

C nodded, understanding the sentiment. "I know, but we can't change the past. All we can do is move forward and try to make the most of the present."

With that, the three friends sat in silence, watching the sun slowly begin to set over the lake. Though their hearts were heavy with grief, they took comfort in each other's presence, knowing that they would support each other through the difficult times ahead.
